title: Showers above 50mm expected in parts of Sri Lanka today
byline: Showers have been predicted at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central, Southern and North-western provinces today (16).

title: Decisive Colombo Municipal Council sitting today
byline: The newly elected Colombo Municipal Council, following the conduct of the Local Government (LG) election on May 6, is scheduled to convene for its inaugural sitting this morning (16).

title: Sri Lankans can enter and exit Israel through Egypt and Jordan – Ambassador
byline: Sri Lankans currently unable to enter Israel due to the closure of the Ben Gurion Airport in Tel Aviv to international flights can make travel arrangements via Jordan and Egypt, Ambassador at the Embassy of Sri Lanka in Israel Nimal Bandara has confirmed.

title: Iran launches new aerial attack on Israel, Israeli strikes kill 244 in Iran
byline: Iran launched a fresh aerial attack on Israel on Sunday night, injuring at least two people and igniting fires, Israeli authorities said.

title: Donald Trump told Israel not to kill Iran’s supreme leader - report
byline: US President Donald Trump rejected a plan by Israel to kill Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, three US officials have told BBC’s US partner CBS News.

title: Colombo MC convenes for inaugural sitting, Members clash over voting method to elect Mayor
byline: The newly elected Colombo Municipal Council, following the conduct of the Local Government (LG) election on May 6, has convened for its inaugural sitting.

title: Assets of 88 individuals frozen over links to organized crime & fraud
byline: Authorities have frozen the assets of 88 individuals linked to organized crime and financial fraud, the police announced.

title: SJB suspends party membership of 6 Dambulla PS members
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has suspended the party membership of six members of the Dambulla Pradeshiya Sabha with immediate effect.

title: Air India Dreamliner returns to Hong Kong after technical issue mid-air
byline: An Air India Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner plane bound for New Delhi returned to its origin of Hong Kong as a precautionary measure on Monday, after the pilot suspected a technical issue mid-air, a source with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.

title: Youth who aided and abetted an attempted murder arrested in Negombo
byline: An individual who aided and abetted an attempted murder by shooting has been taken into custody with narcotics in Negombo.

title: “Sri Lanka’s Road to Recovery: Debt and Governance” conference underway
byline: The “Sri Lanka’s Road to Recovery: Debt and Governance” conference, organized by the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL), commenced a short while ago.

title: Investigators find cockpit voice recorder from crashed Air India flight
byline: Investigators have recovered the cockpit voice recorder (CVR) from the crashed Air India flight, a key step in uncovering what caused last week’s deadly accident.

title: SC hears contempt case against Immigration Controller General
byline: The contempt of court case filed against Controller General of Immigration and Emigration Harsha Illukpitiya, who is currently in remand custody, was taken up for hearing before the Supreme Court today (16).

title: Another Sri Lankan injured in Israel following Iran missile attacks
byline: A Sri Lankan youth in Bnei Brak, Israel has sustained injuries following missile attacks carried out by Iran earlier today (16).

title: IMF’s role in facilitating Sri Lanka’s recovery from economic crisis acknowledged
byline: Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe has acknowledged the strong engagement with the International Monetary Fund, which has been instrumental in facilitating Sri Lanka’s recovery from the recent economic crisis.

title: Sri Lanka economy reports 4.8% growth in first quarter
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy grew 4.8% year-on-year in the first three months of 2025, official data showed on Monday, indicating a deepening recovery from its worst financial crisis in decades.

title: Woman dies in motorcycle-van collision in Minuwangoda
byline: A woman has died following a road accident involving a motorcycle and a van at the Pamunuwa junction along the Minuwangoda–Veyangoda road.

title: President’s Fund to honor top A/L performers
byline: The President’s Fund has launched a program to honor students who excelled at the district level in the 2023/2024 G.C.E. Advanced Level Examination.

title: Trump administration weighs adding 36 countries to travel ban, memo says
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration is considering significantly expanding its travel restrictions by potentially banning citizens of 36 additional countries from entering the United States, according to an internal State Department cable seen by Reuters.

title: IMF First Deputy Managing Director calls on President in Colombo
byline: Visiting First Deputy Managing Director (FDMD) of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Dr. Gita Gopinath has called on President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: NPP also secures power in Ratnapura Municipal Council
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP) today (16) succeeded in establishing power in another Municipal Council and two more Pradeshiya Sabhas.

title: NPP’s Vraie Cally Balthazaar elected new Colombo Mayor
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) councilor Vraie Cally Balthazaar has been elected as the new Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC).

title: Colombo Mayor to be elected through a secret ballot
byline: The proposal to hold a secret ballot to elect the Mayor for the Colombo Municipal Council has been passed unanimously.

title: CID to probe whether presidential pardons misused at other prisons
byline: A senior officer attached to the Ministry of Justice has recorded a statement with the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) over the alleged unlawful release of an inmate of the Anuradhapura Prison under the presidential pardon for Vesak Poya.

title: ‘No room for policy errors’ - warning to Sri Lanka from IMF
byline: With increasing tariffs, developments in the Middle East, uncertainty around energy prices, Sri Lanka has no room for policy errors, according to a stark warning issued by Dr. Gita Gopinath, the First Deputy Managing Director of the International Monetary Fund.

title: Hoping to make Sri Lanka’s current EFF program with IMF the last one - President
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake states that he hopes to make the current Extended Fund Facility (EFF) program with the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the last such program Sri Lanka will need to undertake with the IMF.

title: Two sisters killed on pedestrian crossing in Polgasowita
byline: Two sisters died after being hit by a speeding car while crossing at a pedestrian crossing in Koralaima, Polgasowita, police stated.

title: Landslide early warning issued for several districts extended
byline: The Level-1 Landslide Early Warning issued to several areas in seven districts have been extended, the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) said.

title: Indian students in Iran being moved to safer places as conflict deepens
byline: Some Indian students in Iran have been relocated to “safer places” within the country, the Indian government said in a statement early Monday, stressing that “other feasible options” were also being examined.

title: Sarvajana Balaya to back opposition candidate in Colombo Mayoral election
byline: The ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance has decided to support the candidate nominated by the Opposition parties for the post of the Mayor of the Colombo Municipal Council during today’s vote.

title: Govt. prepares to sell another batch of vehicles
byline: A tender has been called for the sale of used vehicles belonging to the Ministry of Plantation and Community Infrastructure.
